title: Job Market Analysis Group 3
text:
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
import pandas as pd
import plotly.express as px
import plotly.io as pio
import numpy as np

np.random.seed(42)

pio.renderers.default = "notebook"

# Initialize Spark Session
spark = SparkSession.builder.appName("LightcastData").getOrCreate()

# Load Data
df = spark.read.option("header", "true").option("inferSchema", "true").option("multiLine","true").option("escape", "\"").csv("./data/lightcast_job_postings.csv")

# Show Schema and Sample Data
print("---This is Diagnostic check, No need to print it in the final doc---")

df.printSchema() # comment this line when rendering the submission
df.show(5)

Setting default log level to "WARN".
To adjust logging level use sc.setLogLevel(newLevel). For SparkR, use setLogLevel(newLevel).

    "POSTED", "EXPIRED", "MODELED_DURATION"
]

from pyspark.sql.functions import col, sum, when

missing_stats = df_selected.select([
    sum(when(col(c).isNull(), 1).otherwise(0)).alias(c) for c in df_selected.columns
])

missing_stats.show()

from pyspark.sql.functions import col, sum, when

total_count = df.count()


missing_counts = df.select([
    (sum(when(col(c).isNull(), 1).otherwise(0)) / total_count).alias(c) for c in df.columns
]).collect()[0].asDict()


cols_to_keep = [k for k,v in missing_counts.items() if v <= 0.5]

df_clean = df.select(cols_to_keep)

                                                                                



from pyspark.sql.functions import col, sum, when

total_count = df_clean.count() 

missing_counts = df_clean.select([
    sum(when(col(c).isNull(), 1).otherwise(0)).alias(c) for c in df_clean.columns
]).collect()[0].asDict()

for col_name, miss_num in missing_counts.items():
    print(f"{col_name}: {miss_num} missing values")

title: Job Market Analysis Group 3
text: Job Market in US for Data Analytics graduate is booming. This analysis is our project to expolre the career posibilities after graduation.

title: Job Market Analysis Group 3
text: Job Market in US for Data Analytics graduate is booming. This analysis is our project to expolre the career posibilities after graduation.
